required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Protocol to Validate the Performance of the Mellitus Glycated CD59 ELISA for Gestational Diabetes Screening
clinical_study.official_title: Subject Enrollment and Specimen Collection Protocol to Validate the Performance of the Mellitus GCD59 ELISA for Gestational Diabetes Screening

collaborator.agency: Regulatory and Clinical Research Institute Inc

brief_summary.textblock: Demonstrate effective performance of the Mellitus GCD59 Test (an ELISA) in screening for gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM)

detailed_description.textblock: Validate the performance of the Mellitus GCD59 ELISA as a screening test for GDM by evaluating its negative predictive value (NPV) and positive predictive value (PPV) to identify pregnant women at risk for GDM. Sensitivity and specificity of the Mellitus GCD59 ELISA will also be evaluated.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Further product development is needed prior to clinical study testing

primary_outcome.measure: Negative predictive value (NPV) and positive predictive value (PPV) of the Mellitus GCD59 ELISA for gestational diabetes mellitus screening
primary_outcome.time_frame: The 24-28th gestational week of singleton pregnancy
primary_outcome.description: NPV and PPV will be based on two or more abnormal oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT) results (abnormal for OGTT as defined by Carpenter and Coustan diagnostic criteria)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of the Mellitus GCD59 ELISA for gestational diabetes mellitus screening, using two or more abnormal OGTT results (abnormal for OGTT as defined by Carpenter and Coustan diagnostic criteria)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The 24-28th gestational week of singleton pregnancy

secondary_outcome.measure: NPV, PPV, sensitivity and specificity of the GCD59 ELISA for the risk of GDM using one or more abnormal OGTT results
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The 24-28th gestational week of singleton pregnancy

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of the GCD59 ELISA to that of glucose load test (GLT) using two or more abnormal oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT) results
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The 24-28th gestational week of singleton pregnancy

other_outcome.measure: Negative predictive value (NPV) and positive predictive value (PPV) of the GCD59 ELISA for a range of gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) prevalence values likely to be encountered in clinical practice in the United States
other_outcome.time_frame: The 24-28th gestational week of singleton pregnancy

other_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of the GCD59 ELISA across relevant subgroups
other_outcome.time_frame: The 24-28th gestational week of singleton pregnancy

arm_group.description: Non-diabetic women with singleton pregnancy undergoing screening for gestational diabetes who provide plasma samples for testing with the Mellitus GCD59 Test

intervention.description: An ELISA for screening for the risk of gestational diabetes

study_pop.textblock: Nondiabetic women with a singleton pregnancy recommended for routine GDM screening between 24-28 weeks gestation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Women 18 years of age or older at enrollment
2. Has an established viable singleton pregnancy
3. Is recommended for routine GDM screening between 24-28 weeks gestation
4. Has confirmed gestational age of 24-28 weeks at the Screening Visit
5. Is willing and able to provide documentation of informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Has diabetes before pregnancy or has already been diagnosed with GDM
2. Has contraindications for drinking oral glucose solution up to 100 g of sugar
3. Is taking metformin for any reason
4. Has any concomitant illness, disease or condition that, in the clinical judgment of the investigator, is likely to prevent the subject from complying with any aspect of the protocol, or that may put the subject at unacceptable risk

UMass Medical School/UMass Memorial Health Care
